column4: Hello I'm new to linux, is it true that user and root passwords only matters for physical access?

that password is used both locally and remotely - i.e. it will prevent someone with physical access from doing admin-like things on your computer, but it will also prevent them from logging in remotely if you have any sort of remote login facility (such as an SSH server) enabled. ubuntu, by default, doesn't come with any such thing enabled, though.
I see I haven't installed any servers or ssh so I should be safe then
